definition: colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: My first thought was of a TV movie I saw once about nuclear fallout.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一個念頭是在一場電視中看過的原子彈落塵。

sentences.english: Inside a fallout of the fan, one is strong peach.
sentences.chinese: 屋內一柄落塵的扇子，依稀桃花正濃。

sentences.english: The fallout from these explosions fills the air.
Everyday 15 tons of dust smothers the site.
sentences.chinese: 每天有15噸落塵籠罩工地。

sentences.english: This ash soil, the fallout mud dust.
sentences.chinese: 這灰落塵入土，成泥成塵。

sentences.english: Barge to do beautiful mud broken dust eave, the dark corner swept away thousands of feet.
sentences.chinese: 駁離儘儘斑斕泥碎落塵一檐，暗角掃去紅塵千丈。

definition: seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
to ride the dragon/to die (of emperors and kings)
nuée ardente/hot cloud of volcanic ash
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
hard to distinguish real from imitation
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
